parameters.description:
DishTarget is a string array, usually containing dish's host short name (e.g. frank).
To be referred as /dish/sockets/frank for example.
parameters.name: dish_target

parameters.description: If the Host is HTTP/S endpoint, one can specify which HTTP Result/Response codes are okay and not to alert upon.
parameters.name: expected_http_code_array

parameters.description: FailCount indicates how many times socket has to be in failed state before alerting.
parameters.name: fail_count

parameters.description: Healthy boolean indicates wheter is socket okay, or the way around.
parameters.name: healthy

parameters.description: Maintenance boolean states for the M. mode being applied to such socket/endpoint.
parameters.name: maintenance

parameters.description: Muted bool indicates that the socket is not propagated to any dish if true.
parameters.name: muted

parameters.description: PathHTTP is any URL the site is about to be tested on, e.g. /dish/sockets
parameters.name: path_http

parameters.description:
Socket TCP port part
Even default port 80 should be added here.

active.description: Boolean indicating if the service is to be backuped.

description.description: More verbose description of such service backup.

file_destination.description: Path to the file on destination machine.

file_name.description: Name of the compressed backup file.

last_status.description: Last status string of such backup (e.g. success, failure).

timestamp.description: UNIX timestamp of the last provided backup.

contact.description: Array of contacts of different type.

role.description: Business role to such organization (e.g. partner, owner)

username.description: User's name linked to such business.

type.description: Type of contact field (e.g. e-mail address, street address, telephone number etc).

desc.description: Item description, name, amount, type etc.

id.description: Numeric unique ID of such Item.

misc.description: More information, e.g. the more precise location specification.

owner_name.description: Owner name according to users package.

desc.description: Further details about the incident like place, state of operation etc.

public.description: Public indicates the state of visibility for all.

reason.description: Reason of the incident that happened.

socket_id.description:
ID of the referencing socket(s).
SocketID []string `json:"socket_id"`

start_date.description: The very start datetime of such incident.

type.description: Type of incident, e.g. planned, maintenance, outage etc

dish_target.description:
DishTarget is a string array, usually containing dish's host short name (e.g. frank).
To be referred as /dish/sockets/frank for example.

expected_http_code_array.description: If the Host is HTTP/S endpoint, one can specify which HTTP Result/Response codes are okay and not to alert upon.

fail_count.description: FailCount indicates how many times socket has to be in failed state before alerting.

healthy.description: Healthy boolean indicates wheter is socket okay, or the way around.

maintenance.description: Maintenance boolean states for the M. mode being applied to such socket/endpoint.

muted.description: Muted bool indicates that the socket is not propagated to any dish if true.

path_http.description: PathHTTP is any URL the site is about to be tested on, e.g. /dish/sockets

port_tcp.description:
Socket TCP port part
Even default port 80 should be added here.

public.description: Public boolean tells the frontendee to show itself.

response_time.description: ResponseTime is the time for the request to be processed.

socket_description.description: More verbose name/description of the socket.

socket_id.description: Socket ID, snake_cased for socket editing and deleting.

socket_name.description: GEneric name of the socket, to be used in dish results as failed one endpoint for example.

test_timestamp.description: TestTimestamp tells the time of the last socket testing being executed upon.

account_currency.description: Account currency name (e.g. CZK, GBP, EUR, USD)

account_iban.description: Account IBAN code for international payments.

account_owner.description: Owner's name/username to link account to.

account_swift_bic.description: Account SWIFT/BIC code for international payments.

bank_code.description:
Universal in-state bank code (CZ mainly).
Bank codes such as "0100" would be invalid as type int!

amount.description: Payment amount in defined currency (often the account's currency).

business_id.description: BusinessID is a reference to 'business' package.

currency.description: Payment currency name (e.g. CZK, GBP, EUR, USD).

id.description: Item unique ID (e.g. datetime timestamp plus currency etc).

misc.description: Mescellaneous information about the payment (e.g. foreign currency and amount).

payment_date.description: PaymentDate is a datetime of the payment.

type.description: Type defines whether the item is an income, or an expense.

base_sum.description: Difference between incomes and expenses. Base for income tax.

income_tax_estimation_60.description: Weighted estimation of the income tax, where 60% of income are meant as expenses.

income_tax_estimation_abs.description: Absolute estimation of the income tax per year, from given totals.

private_details.description: Private details (e.g. addresses, phone number etc in WHOIS)

children.description: Children of such machine -- should use machines' hashes for proper linking.

datacentre.description: Datacentre is the physical locality of such machine.

description.description: Brief node's description -- shown in node's MOTD on remote login.

domain.description: Host's default domain name (e.g. savla.su as internal domain name).

expires_at.description: EpiresAt is a time of the expiration of such hosting service.

id.description: Unique hash/ID to link to such host record.

ip_address.description: Important network-related IP addresses to be assigned to such host (e.g. public interface address, wireguard interface address etc).

provider.description: Provider is the name of the hosting company of such machine.

roles.description: Ansible roles to be applied to such host.

wireguarded.description: Wireguarded bool indicates that the host is part of the core network.

name.description: Link's name/placeholder, used as an unique key.

link.description: Link to such item -- to the actual article usually.

parse_date_rfc1123z.description: Special date of issue format to reparse/order all news items altogether.

pub_date.description: Date of issue, formatted by issuer.

project_repo.description: Git repository link (not URL, without HTTP scheme).

project_url.description: URL to base page of the project (project's URL).

description.description: Description of such task in human-readable format.

last_change_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the last activity made on this task.

name.description: Taks's ID as an unique identifier in the queue.

processed.description: Processed is an indicator that such task is being worked on.

state.description: State is a human-readable string describing the actual state of the task.

worker_name.description: An identifier of a worker for the task to be executed with.

active.description: Role status, by default it is inactive.

description.description: Role description to make more sense when listing those.

name.description: Role name is its unique description, acts like an ID too.

ACL.description: Access Control List. List of swapi modules to be accessed.

active.description:
Presence/Absence boolean. If false, one is not allowed to log-in (token is rejected),
to interract with savla-dev infra in general (by default).

country.description: Country of origin -- to help maintain global contacts.

email_alias.description: Email alias in cloudflare email routing

gdpr_consent.description:
Important GDPR consent boolean -- if false, user's details should be omitted!
SEE more -- https://gdpr.eu/checklist/

github_username.description: GitHub account/profile name (used for SSH public keys importing).

name.description: ID not used anymore as indexing is used differently now (searching by Name, index respects array implicit property).

roles.description:
User's given roles -- a role labels array.
Roles []roles.Role `json:"roles"`

token_hmac.description: Unique token used for auth purposes, SHA512 preferred.

wireguard_vpn.description: All Wireguard config objects -- an array.

allowed_ips.description: Allowed IP address(es) list on the side of server (vpn_gateway_server).

permission.description: Is the user given permission to dial a connection?

private_key.description:
Wireguard private key.
TODO: should be encrypted?
